meanings.definition: To swing or move excessively beyond a certain point.
meanings.sent1: Tom tends to overswing his golf club, causing him to miss the ball.
meanings.sent2: Don't overswing the bat in baseball, or you might strike out.
meanings.sent3: The monkey overswung from branch to branch, showing off its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions overswing like a pendulum, swinging from joy to sorrow in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum overswings wildly, almost touching the clock's glass cover.

meanings.definition: An excessive or exaggerated swing or movement.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's overswing caused her to lose balance on the beam.
meanings.sent2: His overswing in tennis made him lose control of the racket.
meanings.sent3: The overswing of the pendulum clock made it look like a dancing metronome.
meanings.sent4: The overswing of the wrecking ball demolished the old building in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The overswing of the swing set made the children squeal with delight.
